picks.text: Significantly new OS design on at least one platform
picks.full-pick-text: Significantly new OS design on at least one platform

picks.text: Apple rebrands version numbers of its operating systems
picks.full-pick-text: Apple rebrands version numbers of its operating systems

picks.text: The new version of macOS drops support for some Intel Macs
picks.full-pick-text: The new version of macOS drops support for some Intel Macs

picks.text: New features are announced that are powered by Apple Intelligence
picks.full-pick-text: New features are announced that are powered by Apple Intelligence

picks.text: The updated visionOS gets an eye scrolling feature
picks.full-pick-text: The updated visionOS gets an eye scrolling feature

picks.text: iPadOS gets updated window management tools
picks.full-pick-text: iPadOS gets updated window management tools

picks.text: At least one visionOS app in compatibility mode becomes a native one
picks.full-pick-text: At least one visionOS app in compatibility mode becomes a native one

picks.text: The Google Gemini logo is shown on screen as part of a partnership announcement
picks.full-pick-text: The Google Gemini logo is shown on screen as part of a partnership announcement

picks.text: Apple has a new app for gamers
picks.full-pick-text: Apple has a new app for gamers. It's called Apple Games. It creates new, specific developer terms for games. It features a partnership with Microsoft for Xbox Game Pass.
picks.notes:
• "It's called Apple Games."
  • "It creates new, specific developer terms for games."
  • "It features a partnership with Microsoft for Xbox Game Pass."

picks.text: Apple opens up AFM (Apple Foundation Model) to developers
picks.full-pick-text: Apple opens up AFM (Apple Foundation Model) to developers. It's a 3B parameter version only that runs on device. It's designed in a way that only specific "endpoints" can be used with a native API, like summarization or writing or prioritizing content. Apple shows off examples of how they're using the same tech in its own system apps.
picks.notes:
• "It's a 3B parameter version only that runs on device."
  • "It's designed in a way that only specific "endpoints" can be used with a native API, like summarization or writing or prioritizing content." (In other words, developers won't be able to prompt the API with arbitrary text, they only have access to particular tasks like summarization.)
  • "Apple shows off examples of how they're using the same tech in its own system apps."

picks.text: Apple announces an updated Mac Pro
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces an updated Mac Pro. The starting price remains at $6,999. The starting system on a chip is the Apple M3 Ultra chip with 32-core CPU, 80-core GPU, and 32-core Neural Engine. There is a build-to-order option that exceeds the unified memory available on the Mac Studio, which currently tops out at 512 GB.
picks.notes:
• "The starting price remains at $6,999."
  • "The starting system on a chip is the Apple M3 Ultra chip with 32-core CPU, 80-core GPU, and 32-core Neural Engine."
  • "There is a build-to-order option that exceeds the unified memory available on the Mac Studio, which currently tops out at 512 GB."
  • Like a previous pick, this pick was prophesied in a dream, and one detail of the dream (the size of the Mac Pro wheels) was already confirmed, so it's basically a lock.

picks.text: At least one new OS is referred to by its old marketing name in developer documentation or tools
picks.full-pick-text: At least one new OS is referred to by its old marketing name in developer documentation or tools
picks.notes: • Stephen cites logs mentioning iOS 19 and some "iPadOS 19" documentation.

picks.text: There is no macOS developer beta by the time of recording
picks.full-pick-text: There is no macOS developer beta by the time of recording

picks.full-pick-text: Image Playgrounds is updated to not be quite as terrible

picks.full-pick-text: Apple hints that a new "glass-like" material for its UI design is true to the nature of the hardware itself
picks.notes: • Stephen cites Alan Dye's mention of the rounded corners on many Apple screens influencing the design.
